def.dt: :having life
:active functioning living languages
:exhibiting the life or motion of nature :natural the wilderness is a living museum … of natural history NEA Journal
:live 2a
:full of life or vigor
:true to life :vivid televised in living color
:suited for living the living area
:involving living persons
:very used as an intensive scared the living daylights out of me
:the condition of being alive
:means of subsistence :livelihood earning a living
:estate property
:benefice 1
:conduct or manner of life the collegiate way of living J. B. Conant

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English libban; akin to Old High German lebēn to live

def.dt: :to be alive :have the life of an animal or plant
:to continue alive
:to maintain oneself :subsist lived on rice and peas
:to occupy a home :dwell living in a shabby room they had always lived in the country
:to be located or stored the silverware lives here
:to attain eternal life though he die, yet shall he live John 11:25(Revised Standard Version)
:to conduct or pass one's life lived only for his work
:to remain in human memory or record the past lives in us all W. R. Inge
:to have a life rich in experience
:cohabit
:to pass through or spend the duration of lived their lives alone
:act out practice often used with out to live out their fantasies
:to exhibit vigor, gusto, or enthusiasm in lived life to the fullest
:to experience firsthand living a dream
:to be thoroughly absorbed by or involved with she lives her work
:to live with gusto and usually fast and loose lived it up with wine and song Newsweek
:to act or be in accordance with had no intention of living up to his promise
:to put up with :accept tolerate had to live with their decision
:life emptied of joys and satisfactions
:an organism (as a horseshoe crab or a ginkgo tree) that has remained essentially unchanged from earlier geologic times and whose close relatives are usually extinct
:a room in a residence used for the common social activities of the occupants
:lebensraum called also living space
:standard of living
:a trust that becomes effective during the lifetime of the settlor called also inter vivos trust
:an apartment or house for use by one family
:a subsistence wage
:a wage sufficient to provide the necessities and comforts essential to an acceptable standard of living
